page.title: 05LOCAL AMENITIES,TOURISM.
page.content: Lytham St.Annes{"Jewel of the Fylde {Coast."}This is what the brochures claim to be a clear description of the town.Pictures show that Lytham has a beach which is the perfect place to sunbathe.It may have been in the past,but now it is just an unattractive area consisting of{ {Spartina townsendii,}debris,seaweed and mud.There is no trace of a sandy beach.Reclamation and finance is essential. However, Lytham Green does offer facilities for picnickers and sunbathers where children can play,but even that is wearing away and becoming brown in patches and will continue to do so if neglected. The town centre of Lytham offers a wide range of shops.However ,some Lythamers do feel that there is a need for a{"Chain Store"}(Marks & Spencers)
